name: Cheeseburger Salad
description: No buns? No problem. Make cheeseburger salad when you want a crunchy, fresh twist on the classic burger.
recipeIngredient: 1 small onion, halved and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.name: Shape the burgers
recipeInstructions.text: Crumble the ground beef into a large bowl, and add the steak seasoning. Lightly mix the spice into the beef—don't overmix, as this will give the burgers a tougher texture. Shape the beef mixture into 20 miniature patties that are about 2 inches in diameter and 1/2-inch thick.

recipeInstructions.name: Grill the burgers
recipeInstructions.text: Set an outdoor grill to medium heat. You can also use a grill surface on your stove or an indoor grill. Grill the mini burgers, covered, for three to four minutes per side. The internal temperature should read 160°F on a digital thermometer. Let the burgers cool slightly.

recipeInstructions.name: Assemble the salad
recipeInstructions.text: Toss together the torn lettuce, cheddar cheese, croutons, tomato, onion, pickles and burgers in a large bowl. Drizzle Thousand Island dressing over the salad. Serve immediately. Editor's Note: You can also keep the burgers separate from the salad. Portion the salad into individual bowls, then add mini burgers to the tops, followed by a drizzle of dressing.

review.reviewBody: We thought this was very good. Dinner on the table 30 minutes or less. I didn’t make the patty’s. I cooked it crumbled in the skillet and the cheese was co Jack pre shredded. We will have this again.

Great taste!  I used romaine lettuce, served the dressing on the side, and skipped the croutons and served it in pita bread.  Will definitely make this again.  Makes a great lunch!  Make ahead keeping the burger separate and microwave it before adding it to the salad.
Did not form the meat into burgers; just browned the meat and added the onion. I also left out the croutons (which I don't like). Turned out pretty well!

This was a very good salad and my husband liked it as well.  Bonus: I had tossed the entire recipe in the dressing but there was only 2 of us - it makes generous single servings for 4 but we still had quite a bit left.  Not wanting it to go to waste, I fridged it all in a glass container - aside from being a smidge soft and the croutons being soggy of course, it was actually very tasty for a left-over already-dressed salad!!  So don't throw away leftovers!!!!!

Very yummy!!! I felt the burgers were a bit too salty so will cut back on the seasoning next time (yes, there will definitely be a next time). I grilled the burgers and melted a little bit of the cheese right on to each of the mini burgers, feel this made a big difference. Also, I cut back the cheese by half, as I felt that was way too much cheese. With my small alterations, I loved it!!!
Really good! Even the kids liked it!
I enjoyed it, but my husband didn't care for it.  But, he isn't that fond of Thousand Island dressing.
Very different  spin on a cheeseburger recipe. My family thought it was pretty good.
